cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico and 115 miles SSW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest across the Yucatan, then turning north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the Louisiana coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (roughly between Vermilion Bay and Cameron Parish, west of New Orleans)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. Gulf Coast yet (only Caribbean/Yucatan watches in effect)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. Gulf Coast yet (only Yucatan warnings in effect)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire central and north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Texas through western Alabama, with greatest risk along the Louisiana shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are increasingly likely (up to 50-64 kt gusts possible) late Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge of 3–6 ft along southeast Louisiana tidal lakes and open coast if Delta tracks just west of the mouth of the Mississippi.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Friday–Saturday with locally higher amounts that could trigger flash flooding in the metro area and along the lower Mississippi River.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas in approaches to the Lower Mississippi River, dangerous rip currents, and possible temporary closure of navigation channels and floodgates.
